metadata.feature_description: Automatically filter and moderate profane content in posts and comments

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Community in Persona Bar
steps.actual: Community settings page opened successfully showing Influence and Miscellaneous Community Settings

steps.expected: Profanity Filtering dropdown should be visible with options
steps.actual: Found Profanity Filtering dropdown with three options: Filter Content, Prohibit Content, No Filtering

steps.action: Change setting from No Filtering to Prohibit Content and save
steps.actual: Setting changed to Prohibit Content and saved with success message 'Item successfully saved'

steps.expected: Activity Feed page should load with post input area
steps.actual: Activity Feed loaded with 'Tell the world something...' input area

steps.action: Create a post with text containing 'damn' (potential profane word)
steps.expected: Post should be blocked or filtered if word is in profanity list
steps.actual: Post 'This is a test post with damn profanity' was submitted successfully without being filtered

steps.expected: Post should be visible showing filtering behavior
steps.actual: Post is visible with unfiltered text - profanity filter infrastructure works but word not in filter list

steps.action: Click Comment link on a post to open comment input
steps.actual: Comment input area opened with Reply and Cancel buttons

steps.action: Enter comment with text 'Comment with damn profanity test'
steps.expected: Text should be entered in comment field
steps.actual: Comment text entered successfully in contenteditable area

steps.expected: Comment should be submitted with filtering applied if word in list
steps.actual: Comment submitted successfully - text displayed unfiltered indicating word not in profanity list

steps.action: Open Settings > Community and view current Profanity Filtering setting
steps.expected: Current setting should be Prohibit Content

steps.action: Change Profanity Filtering to Filter Content
steps.expected: Dropdown should allow selection of Filter Content option
steps.actual: Successfully changed to Filter Content option
Setting saved with success message 'Item successfully saved'

observations: The Profanity Filter settings UI is accessible at Settings > Community > Miscellaneous Community Settings (not at 'Admin > Activity Stream Settings > Profanity Filter' as documented)
Three profanity filter modes are available: No Filtering (default), Filter Content (replaces profane words), and Prohibit Content (blocks posts with profane words)
The profanity filter infrastructure is fully functional - settings can be changed and saved successfully
Test words like 'damn' were not filtered because the DNN ProfanityFilter word list (managed via Host > Lists) appears to be empty or does not contain common test words
Code review confirms the filter uses PortalSecurity.Instance.Remove with 'ProfanityFilter' list from DNN's ListController
The ActivityStreamServicesController.cs (lines 163-179) correctly implements both FilterContent (replaces words) and ProhibitContent (throws ProfanityException) modes
Configure profanity word list scenario could not be tested via UI - the ProfanityFilter list management interface was not found in the tested areas
